an11.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an11.1:1.3: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an11.1:1.4: “Sir, what is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics?”
an11.1:1.5: “Ānanda, having no regrets is the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics.”
an11.1:2.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets?”
an11.1:2.2: “Joy is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets.”
an11.1:3.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of joy?”
an11.1:4.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of rapture?”
an11.1:5.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of tranquility?”
an11.1:6.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of bliss?”
an11.1:7.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of immersion?”
an11.1:8.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing?”
an11.1:9.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment?”
an11.1:10.1: “But what is the purpose and benefit of dispassion?”
an11.1:10.2: “Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of dispassion.
an11.1:11.1: So, Ānanda, the purpose and benefit of skillful ethics is not having regrets.
an11.1:11.2: Joy is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
an11.1:11.3: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of joy.
an11.1:11.4: Tranquility is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
an11.1:11.5: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquility.
an11.1:11.6: Immersion is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
an11.1:11.7: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of immersion.
an11.1:11.8: Disillusionment is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing.
an11.1:11.9: Dispassion is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment.
an11.1:11.10: And knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of dispassion.
an11.1:11.11: So, Ānanda, skillful ethics progressively lead up to the highest.”
